metadata.title: Build Patient Profile Page Shell with Bento Cards and Tabs

context.background: This task implements Build Patient Profile Page Shell with Bento Cards and Tabs for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Build Patient Profile Page Shell with Bento Cards and Tabs in the planned files (healio/app/(dashboard)/patients/[id]/page.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-profile-header.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-demographics-card.tsx, healio/components/patients/patient-medical-summary-card.tsx ...) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: GET /api/v1/patients/:id) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): GET /api/v1/patients/:id and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Build Patient Profile Page Shell with Bento Cards and Tabs is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 3 Patient Profile Page) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-patients): patient profile bento shell ui

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patient-detail-route.test.ts; Chrome DevTools MCP on http://localhost:4011/patients/:id
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented the patient chart shell at `/patients/[id]` using a Viedoc-style bento layout (header metrics + demographics + medical summary + tabs) with a Stripe-style in-context edit drawer placeholder. Added `usePatientDetail` and validated the chart on a fresh dev server (`4011`) after a transient Next.js dev/HMR API bundling corruption on an earlier server process (`4010`) caused a false 500 unrelated to the task code.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.
API regression check: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/patient-detail-route.test.ts` passed (GET/PATCH patient detail route behavior unchanged).

Chrome DevTools MCP verification on `http://localhost:4011/patients/pat_...`: confirmed GET `/api/v1/patients/:id` = 200 success state; tabs (Overview/Visits/Documents) switch correctly; edit drawer opens in-context and closes via `Escape`; desktop and mobile layouts render with bottom nav visible on mobile.

Chrome DevTools MCP not-found verification on `http://localhost:4011/patients/pat_missing`: GET `/api/v1/patients/pat_missing` = 404 and the page shows the intended educational empty state with Retry/Go Back actions.

Chrome DevTools MCP console check: only expected messages (React DevTools dev info and a single expected 404 console entry during the intentional not-found verification). Screenshot captured for not-found mobile state.

Operational note: an earlier dev process on `4010` produced a Next.js HMR/runtime bundling error (`__webpack_modules__[moduleId] is not a function`) for `/api/v1/patients/[id]`; verification was rerun successfully on a fresh dev process (`4011`) to avoid a false blocker.
Implementation commit: 4d2a174 (feat(healio-patients): patient profile bento shell ui).
